newsitem.title: USA: Magic Software sees Q2 loss of $4.3 mln.
newsitem.headline: Magic Software sees Q2 loss of $4.3 mln.

text.p: Magic Software Enterprises Ltd said Thursday it expects a net loss of about $4.3 million for the quarter ended June 30 on revenues of about $9.0 million.
The company said the loss includes about $2.6 million of non-recurring expenses.
Included in the non-recurring expenses were restructuring costs, including employee dismissal and relocation expenses, of about $1.6 million.

The company said it also includes a $1.0 million charge, which represents the cumulative effect of changes in accounting treatment of Israeli Government sponsored R&D grants from a new agreement with the Israeli Ministry of Industry and Trade's Office of the Chief Scientist.
The company also said its expected loss a result of "sub-critical-mass sales" in several of its major markets.
In response to the need for improved results, the company said it will be making operating changes and relocations across North America and Japan.
The company expects to release its second quarter results on August 4.
